quote: The perception of what a thing is and the perception of what it means are not separate, either.

author: James J. Gibson
quote: The meaning or value of a thing consists of what it affords.

author: James J. Gibson
quote: The hypothesis that things have affordances, and that we perceive or learn to perceive them, is very promising, radical, but not yet elaborated.

author: James J. Gibson
quote: The human young must learn to perceive these affordances, in some degree at least, but the young of some animals do not have time to learn the ones that are crucial for survival.

author: James J. Gibson
quote: The abstract analysis of the world by mathematics and physics rests on the concepts of space and time.

quote: Hence it is that the shape of something is especially meaningful.

quote: You go from being excited to panicking a little bit when a guy slides into him. Your emotions can get a little wavy. For me, being a baseball player, it's just exciting to watch what kids can do. When you think about it, he probably should be a junior in college.

author: Joe Girardi
quote: They're making decisions really tough around here. The idea was to let them fight it out. Let's let them fight it out and go from there.

author: Joe Girardi
quote: He's put together a pretty good little stretch here. The thing we've talked about the whole way is consistency through the whole year, understanding you are going to go through some struggles. How are you able to get out of them? Are you able to get out of them quicker than other players? Those are the great players.

author: Joe Girardi
quote: You get to teach. You get to manage. I love the competition and I love the idea of trying to figure out how to beat the other team.

author: Joe Girardi
quote: We counted it up. We hit 11 balls on the button. And what did we get, five hits?

author: Joe Girardi
quote: Guys are just doing the little things, taking advantage. And our two-strike at bats the first two days have been tremendous.

author: Joe Girardi
quote: He showed he has the ability to drive in runs. We need that all up and down the lineup.

author: Indigo Girls
quote: Whatever happened to anyone else could happen to you and to me - And the end of my youth was the possible truth that it all happens randomly.

author: Indigo Girls
quote: And even I have got to laugh at me.

author: Indigo Girls
quote: With all the blood newly dried in the desert, can we not fertilize the land with something else?

author: Indigo Girls
quote: yeah but what it takes to cross the great divideseems more than all the courage I can muster up insidealthough we get to have some answers when we reach the other sidethe prize is always worth the rocky ride

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: I am the letter ``A'' among the alphabets, among the compound words I am the dual compound, I am the endless time, I am the sustainer of all, and have faces on all sides (or I am omniscient).

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: The live in wisdom who see themselves in all and all in them, who have renounced every selfish desire and sense craving tormenting the heart.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: When you move amidst the world of sense, free from attachment and aversion alike, there comes the peace in which all sorrows end, and you life in the wisdom of the Self.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: Action should culminate in wisdom.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: Arjuna saw the entire universe, divided in many ways, but standing as [all in] One [and One in all] in the body of Krishna, the God of gods.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: I believe You are the imperishable, the Supreme to be realized. You are the ultimate resort of the universe.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: Your powerful radiance is burning the entire universe, and filling it with splendor, O Krishna.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: There is nothing higher than Brahman. Everything in the universe is strung on Brahman like jewels on the thread of a necklace.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: He from whom all beings originate, and by whom all this universe is pervaded; worshipping Him by performing one's natural duty for Him one attains perfection.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: This being the case; the ignorant person who considers oneself as the sole agent due to imperfect understanding does not understand.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: Success in work comes quickly in this human world.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: Bodies of the eternal, imperishable, and incomprehensible soul are said to be perishable. Therefore, fight, O Arjuna.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: The wise should work without attachment, for the welfare of the society.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: Even if one is the most sinful of all sinners, yet one shall cross over the ocean of sin by the raft of knowledge alone.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: Living creatures are nourished by food, and food is nourished by rain; rain itself is the water of life, which comes from selfless worship and service.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: One feels infinite bliss that is perceivable only through the intellect, and is beyond the reach of the senses. After realizing Brahman, one is never separated from absolute reality.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: A person who has subdued the senses and completely renounced [the fruits of] all works, dwells happily in the City of Nine Gates, neither performing nor directing action.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: He who considers this [Self ] as a slayer or he who thinks that this [Self] is slain, neither of these knows the Truth. For it does not slay, nor is it slain.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: Established in Self-Realization, one is not moved even by the greatest calamity.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: The yogi who diligently strives, perfecting [gradually] through many incarnations, becomes completely free from all sins and reaches the Self-realization.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: As the all-pervading ether is not tainted because of its subtlety, similarly the Self, seated in everybody, is not tainted.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: After Self-Realization , one does not regard any other gain superior to Self-Realization.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: The one who rejoices in the Self only, who is satisfied with the Self, who is content in the Self alone, for such a [Self-realized] person there is no duty.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: All these (seekers) are indeed noble, but I regard the wise as My very Self, because the one who is steadfast becomes one with the Supreme Being.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: Today I have described the same ancient science to you, because you are my sincere devotee and friend. Karma-yoga is a supreme secret indeed.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: Thus handed down in succession the royal sages knew this (Karma-yoga). After a long time the science of Karma-yoga was lost from this earth.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: Thus this most secret science has been explained by Me, O sinless Arjuna. Having understood this, one becomes enlightened and one's all duties are accomplished.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: Thus many types of sacrifice are described in the Vedas. Know them all to be born from Karma or the action of body, mind, and senses. Knowing this, you shall attain nirvana.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: After realizing Brahman, one is never separated from absolute reality.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: Fear not what is not real, never was and never will be. What is real, always was and cannot be destroyed.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: Some offer their wealth, their austerity, and their practice of yoga as sacrifice, while the ascetics with strict vows offer their study of scriptures and knowledge as sacrifice.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: I am the power of rulers, the statesmanship of the seekers of victory.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: The pleasure one enjoys from [spiritual] practice results in cessation of sorrow.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: The one who shall propagate this supreme secret philosophy amongst My devotees, shall be performing the highest devotional service to Me and shall certainly attain Me.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: The yogi who knows all this goes beyond getting the benefits of the study of the Vedas, performance of sacrifices, austerities, and charities, and attains the Supreme eternal abode.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: Scarcely one out of thousands of persons strives for perfection of Self-realization.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: Such a person soon becomes righteous and attains everlasting peace. Be aware, O Arjuna, that My devotee never falls down.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: Little by little, through patience and repeated effort, the mind will become stilled in the Self.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: One is considered the best yogi who regards every being like oneself, and who can feel the pain and pleasures of others as one's own.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: The senses have been conditioned by attraction to the pleasant and aversion to the unpleasant: a man should not be ruled by them; they are obstacles in his path.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: Smoke, night, the dark lunar fortnight, and the six months of southern solstice of the sun; departing by these paths, the righteous person attains lunar light (or heaven) and reincarnates.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: Persons of demonic nature do not know what to do and what not to do. They neither have purity nor good conduct nor truthfulness.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: I look upon all creatures equally; none are less dear to me and none more dear. But those who worship me with love live in me, and I come to life in them.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: People do not know My true transcendental nature. Therefore, they fall.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: One's inferior natural work is better than superior unnatural work. One who does the work ordained by one's inherent nature incurs no sin.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: I am the supporter of the universe, the father, the mother, and the grandfather.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: The serenity of mind, gentleness, silence, self-restraint, and the purity of mind are called the austerity of thought.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: Yoga is difficult for the one whose mind is not subdued.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: The mind alone is one's friend as well as one's enemy.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: I am easily attainable, O Arjuna, by that ever steadfast yogi who always thinks of Me and whose mind does not go elsewhere.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: By always keeping the mind fixed on the Self, the yogi whose mind is subdued attains peace of the Supreme nirvana by uniting with Me.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: In My opinion, yoga is difficult for the one whose mind is not subdued. However, yoga is attainable by the person of subdued mind by striving through proper means.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: Sitting and concentrating the mind on a single object, controlling the thoughts and the activities of the senses, let the yogi practice meditation for self-purification.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: Because the mind, indeed, is very unsteady, turbulent, powerful, and obstinate, O Krishna. I think restraining the mind is as difficult as restraining the wind.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: They, whose mind and intellect are absorbed in the Self, who remain firmly attached with the Self, who have Self as their supreme goal, whose sins have been destroyed by the knowledge, do not take birth again.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: What is work and what is not work are questions that perplex the wisest of men.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: I am the origin of all. Everything emanates from Me. Understanding this, the wise ones worship Me with love and devotion.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: I give the knowledge, to those who are ever united with Me and lovingly adore Me.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: Among the knowledge I am knowledge of the supreme Self. I am logic of the logician.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: Better indeed is knowledge than mechanical practice. Better than knowledge is meditation. But better still is surrender of attachment to results, because there follows immediate peace.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: But, those who carp at My teaching and do not practice it, consider them as ignorant of all knowledge, senseless, and lost.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: Those who are devoid of attachment, whose mind is fixed in knowledge, all deeds of such liberated persons dissolves away.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: A yogi is called Self-realized who is satisfied with knowledge and understanding of the Self.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: Knowledge is better than mere ritualistic practice, meditation is better than mere knowledge, renunciation of the fruit of work is better than meditation, peace immediately follows the renunciation of (the attachment to) the fruit of work.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: Seers whose sins (or imperfections) are destroyed, whose doubts have been dispelled by knowledge, whose disciplined minds are attached with the Self, and who are engaged in the welfare of all beings attain Supreme Brahman.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: The knowledge sacrifice is superior to any material sacrifice.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: Knowing that, O Arjuna, you shall not again get deluded like this. By this knowledge you shall behold the entire creation in your own Self/Lord, or in Brahman.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: Verily there is no purifier in this world like knowledge. One who becomes purified by Karma-yoga discovers this knowledge within (naturally) in course of time. (See also 4.31, and 5.06).

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: Those who have taken refuge in this knowledge attain unity with Me, and are neither born at the time of creation nor afflicted at the time of dissolution.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: Four types of virtuous ones worship or seek Me, O Arjuna. They are: the distressed, the seeker of Self-knowledge, the seeker of wealth, and the wise one who knows the Supreme.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: Some worship Me by knowledge sacrifice. Others worship the infinite as the one in all [or non-dual], as the master of all [or dual], and in various other ways.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: Learn from Me briefly, O Arjuna, how one who has attained such perfection realizes Brahman, the supreme state of knowledge.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: Verily there is no purifier in this world like knowledge.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: Thus the knowledge that is more secret than the secret has been explained to you by Me. After fully reflecting on this, do as you wish.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: This knowledge is the king of all knowledge, is the most secret, is very sacred, it can be perceived by instinct, conforms to Dharma, is very easy to practice, and is imperishable.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: Undivided, yet appears as if divided in beings; He, the object of knowledge, is the creator, sustainer, and destroyer of (all) beings.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: Knowledge is better than mere ritualistic practice.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: What is the need for this detailed knowledge, O Arjuna? I continually support the entire universe by a small fraction of My energy.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: The one by whom others are not agitated, and who is not agitated by others; who is free from joy, envy, fear, and anxiety; is also dear to Me.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: A person whose mind is unattached to sensual pleasures, who discovers the joy of the Self, and whose mind is in union with Brahman through meditation, enjoys eternal bliss.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: It is better to do one's own duty, however defective it may be, than to follow the duty of another, however well one may perform it. He who does his duty as his own nature reveals it, never sins.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: Know Me to be the eternal seed of all creatures. I am the intelligence of the intelligent, and the brilliance of the brilliant.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: The sage awakes to light in the night of all creatures. That which the world calls day is the night of ignorance to the wise.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: The unsuccessful yogi is reborn, after attaining heaven and living there for many years, in the house of the pure and prosperous.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: That one I love who is incapable of ill will, and returns love for hatred. Living beyond the reach of I and mind, and of pain and pleasure, full of mercy, contented, self-controlled, with all his heart and all his mind given to Me -- with such a one I am in love.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: That one I love who is incapable of ill will, and returns love for hatred. Living beyond the reach of I and mind, and of pain and pleasure, full of mercy, contented, self-controlled, with all his heart and all his mind given to Me / with such a one I am in love.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: One who does not hate any creature, who is friendly and compassionate, free from (the notion of) ``I'' and ``my'', even-minded in pain and pleasure, forgiving; and / The yogi who is ever content, who has subdued the mind, whose resolve is firm, whose mind and intellect are engaged in dwelling upon Me; such a devotee is dear to Me.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: Neither in this world nor elsewhere is there any happiness in store for him who always doubts.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: The foods that promote longevity, virtue, strength, health, happiness, and joy; are juicy, smooth, substantial, and agreeable to the stomach.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: One who finds happiness with the Self, who rejoices the Self within, and who is illuminated by the Self-knowledge; such a yogi attains supreme nirvana.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: You grieve for those who are not worthy of grief, and yet speak the words of wisdom. The wise grieve neither for the living nor for the dead.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: Alas! We are ready to commit a great sin by striving to slay our kinsmen because of greed for the pleasures of the kingdom.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: Whatever I am offered in devotion with a pure heart -- a leaf, a flower, fruit, or water -- I accept with joy.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: To the illumined man or woman, a clod of dirt, a stone, and gold are the same.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: God is in everything as well as above everything.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: They say that the world is unreal, without a substratum, without a God, and without an order.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: Wearing divine garlands and apparel, anointed with celestial perfumes and ointments, full of all wonders, the limitless God with faces on all sides.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: Having abandoned attachment to the fruits of work, ever content, and dependent on no one [but God]; though engaged in activity, one does nothing at all.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: Steadfastness in knowledge of the Supreme Spirit, and the perception of [the omnipresent God as] the object of true knowledge is called knowledge; what is contrary to this is ignorance.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: O Krishna, I have heard from You in detail about the origin and dissolution of beings, and Your imperishable glory.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: Whatever is endowed with glory, brilliance, and power; know that to be a manifestation of a fraction of My splendor.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: No one attains perfection by merely giving up work.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: I know, O Arjuna, the beings of the past, of the present, and those of the future, but no one really knows Me.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: One does not attain freedom from the bondage of Karma by merely abstaining from work. No one attains perfection by merely giving up work.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: A person is said to have achieved yoga, the union with the Self, when the perfectly disciplined mind gets freedom from all desires, and becomes absorbed in the Self alone.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: He is not elevated by good fortune or depressed by bad. His mind is established in God, and he is free from delusion.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: Brahman is the oblation. Brahman is the clarified butter. The oblation is poured by Brahman into the fire of Brahman. Brahman shall be realized by the one who considers everything as (a manifestation or) an act of Brahman.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: Fire, light, daytime, the bright lunar fortnight, and the six months of the northern solstice of the sun; departing by the path of these gods the yogis, who know Brahman, attain nirvana.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: The sun does not illumine there, nor the moon, nor the fire. That is My supreme abode. Having reached there they do not come back.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: As the blazing fire reduces wood to ashes, similarly, the fire of Self-knowledge reduces all Karma to ashes.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: When the senses contact sense objects, a person experiences cold or heat, pleasure or pain. These experiences are fleeting they come and go. Bear them patiently.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: I am delighted by beholding that which has never been seen before, and yet my mind is tormented with fear.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: Some philosophers say that all work is full of faults and should be given up, while others say that acts of sacrifice, charity, and austerity should not be abandoned.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: Seeing fathers-in-law, all those kinsmen, and other dear ones standing in the ranks of the two armies, / Arjuna was overcome with great compassion and sorrowfully said: O Krishna, seeing my kinsmen standing with a desire to fight, / My limbs fail and my mouth becomes dry. My body quivers and my hairs stand on end.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: When meditation is mastered, the mind is unwavering like the flame of a lamp in a windless place.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: A person is known by the faith.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: Whoever hears this with faith and without cavil becomes free from sin, and attains heaven (or the higher regions for those whose actions are pure).

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: Those who always practice this teaching of Mine, with faith and free from cavil, are freed from the bondage of Karma.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: Even those devotees who worship demigods with faith, they too worship Me, but in an improper way.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: But those devotees who have faith and sincerely try to develop the above mentioned immortal virtues, and set Me as their supreme goal; are very dear to Me.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: Whosoever desires to worship whatever deity with faith, I make their faith steady in that very deity.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: Endowed with steady faith they worship that deity, and fulfill their wishes through that deity. Those wishes are, indeed, granted only by Me.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: The one who has faith, and is sincere, and has mastery over the senses, gains this knowledge. Having gained this, one at once attains the supreme peace.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: I consider one to be the most devoted of all the yogis who lovingly contemplates on Me with supreme faith.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: On this path effort never goes to waste, and there is no failure. Even a little effort toward spiritual awareness will protect you from the greatest fear.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: Seeing Your great effulgent and various-colored form touching the sky; Your mouth wide open and large shining eyes; I am frightened and find neither peace nor courage, O Krishna.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: One who neither rejoices nor grieves, neither likes nor dislikes, who has renounced both the good and the evil, and who is full of devotion, such a person is dear to Me.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: Anybody, including women, merchants, laborers, and the evil-minded can attain the supreme goal by just surrendering unto My will [with loving devotion].

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: The evil doers, the ignorant, the lowest persons who are attached to demonic nature, and whose intellect has been taken away by Maya do not worship or seek Me.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: Everything has been accomplished in this very life by those whose mind is set in equality.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: One who does not envy but us a compassionate friend to all ... such a devotee is very dear to Me.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: Know that all creatures have evolved from this twofold energy, and Brahman is the origin as well as the dissolution of the entire universe.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: Conquer your enemies and enjoy a prosperous kingdom. All these [warriors] have already been destroyed by Me. You are only an instrument, O Arjuna.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: If due to ego you think: I shall not fight; this resolve of yours is vain. Your own nature will compel you.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: Entering the earth I support all beings with My energy; becoming the sap-giving moon I nourish all the plants.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: The ancient seekers of liberation also performed their duties with this understanding. Therefore, you should do your duty as the ancients did.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: Therefore, always remember Me and do your duty. You shall certainly attain Me if your mind and intellect are fixed on Me.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: You should perform your duty [with apathetic frame of mind]  with a view to guide people and for the universal welfare.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: Always perform your duty efficiently and without attachment to the results, because by doing work without attachment one attains the Supreme.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: Karma does not bind one who has renounced work (by renouncing the fruits of work) through Karma-yoga; whose doubt is completely destroyed by knowledge; and who is Self-realized, O Arjuna.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: Therefore, resort to Karma-yoga and cut the ignorance-born doubt abiding in your heart by the sword of Self-knowledge, and get up (to fight), O Arjuna.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: In Karma-yoga no effort is ever lost, and there is no harm. Even a little practice of this discipline protects one from great fear [of birth and death].

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: Sever the ignorant doubt in your heart with the sword of self-knowledge. Observe your discipline. Arise.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: The resolute determination [of Self-realization] is not formed in the minds of those who are attached to pleasure and power; and whose discernment is obscured by such [ritualistic] activities.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: The desire for sensual pleasures fades away if one abstains from sense enjoyment, but the craving  [for sense enjoyment] remains. The craving also disappears from the one who has seen [or known] the Supreme.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: Works do not bind Me, because I have no desire for the fruits of work.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: This has been gained by me today, I shall fulfill this desire, this is mine and this wealth also shall be mine in the future.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: A person is said to have attained yogic perfection when there is no desire for sensual pleasures, or attachment to the fruits of work, and has renounced all personal selfish motives.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: Dedicating all works to Me in a spiritual frame of mind, free from desire, attachment, and mental grief, do your duty.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: I desire neither victory nor pleasure nor kingdom, O Krishna. What is the use of the kingdom, or enjoyment, or even life, O Krishna?

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: Treating pleasure and pain, gain and loss, victory and defeat alike, engage yourself in your duty. By doing your duty this way you will not incur sin.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: The light of all lights, He is said to be beyond darkness. He is the knowledge, the object of knowledge, and seated in the hearts of all beings, He is to be realized by the knowledge.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: The light of all lights, He is said to be beyond darkness.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: The path of light and the path of darkness [of materialism and ignorance] are thought to be the world's two eternal paths.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: It is better to do thine own duty, however lacking in merit, than to do that of another, even though efficiently. It is better to die doing one's own duty, for to do the duty of another is fraught with danger.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: O Arjuna, now behold the entire creation; animate, inanimate, and whatever else you like to see; all at one place in My body.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: just as one sun illuminates this entire world, similarly the creator illumines [or gives life to] the entire creation.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: Know Me to be the creator of all creation.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: The one who does not help to keep the wheel of creation in motion by sacrificial duty, and who rejoices in sense pleasures, that sinful person lives in vain.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: Thus the creation as well as the knowledge and the object of knowledge have been briefly described. Understanding this, My devotee attains Me.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: These acts of creation do not bind Me, O Arjuna, because I remain indifferent and unattached to those acts.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: Having hands and feet everywhere; having eyes, head, and face everywhere; having ears everywhere; the creator exists in the creation by pervading everything.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: What the creation is, what it is like, what its transformations are, where the source is, who that creator is, and what His powers are, hear all these from Me in brief.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: But great souls, who possess divine qualities know Me as the cause of creation and imperishable, and worship Me single-mindedly.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: Using My nature I create, again and again, the entire multitude of beings that are helpless, being under the control of nature.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: A disciplined person, enjoying sense objects with senses that are under control and free from likes and dislikes, attains tranquillity.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: Let the yogi seated in solitude and alone having mind and senses under control and free from desires and attachments for possessions, try constantly to contemplate on the Supreme Self.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: A man's own self is his friend. A man's own self is his foe.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: Out of compassion I destroy the darkness of their ignorance. From within them I light the lamp of wisdom and dispel all darkness from their lives.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: Out of compassion for them I, who dwell within their heart, destroy the darkness born of ignorance by the shining lamp of knowledge.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: My illusion is dispelled by Your profound words, that You spoke out of compassion towards me, about the supreme secret of the Self.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: Neither by study of the Vedas, nor by austerity, nor by charity, nor by ritual, can I be seen in this form as you have seen Me.

author: Bhagavad Gita
quote: Various types of sacrifice, charity, and austerity are performed by the seekers of nirvana by uttering 'TAT' [or He is all] without seeking a reward.

author: Bhagavad Gita

There is the same difference in a person before and after he is in love as there is in an unlighted lamp and one that is burning. I do not have great plans for the future; if for a moment I feel rising within me the desire for a life without care, for prosperity, each time I go fondly back to the trouble and the cares, to a life full of hardship, and think: It is better so; I learn more from it, and make progress. This is not the road on which one perishes. I only hope the trouble and the cares will not become unbearable, and I have confidence I shall succeed in earning enough to keep myself, not in luxury, but as one who eats his bread in the sweat of his brow.

However, we know from The Conference Board's long running Help-Wanted Index for print ads, as well as the Federal Bureau of Labor Statistics' job vacancy index (JOLTS) that businesses typically decrease their recruitment in the last two months of the year. This seasonal November decline typically reflects the Thanksgiving holiday and a slowdown in recruitments after a seasonal upturn in the late summer/early fall. Year-end budget constraints may also play a role if funds are short for paid advertisements. Nationally, the downturn in new online ad volume the week before and the week of Thanksgiving more than offset the modest increases in the other weeks in November.

author: Edgar Guest

author: Edgar Guest
quote: You are the person who has to decide. Whether you'll do it or toss it aside; You are the person who makes up your mind. Whether you'll lead or will linger behind. Whether you'll try for the goal that's afar. Or just be contented to stay where you are.
